2/24/2015 5:10:13 PM
Our dependence on computers has increased tremendously. Right from running a school to a railway system or an aeroplane, we are depepndent on computers. Do you think, our lives are going to become more dependent on computers as technology advances? Is this dependence good for our overall development? Give reason.
                yes it is good , computers helps us in increasing our knowledge and it helps us in connecting people all around the world . computers are nothing but an electronic device which provide so much of information which is helpful in our day to day life. computers has so many features like vedio calling like Skype , oovvoo nd  facebook , Google like google talk google+ etc which helps in connect our family members and friends . Now a days so many schools and colleges are providing computer classes and labs so that students should knowledge about the computers.

                computers are used in all Mnc so that work can  be done easily.computer provides network sharing through which data can be shared from one compute to another through mails like yahoo mail , gmail . computer has so many applications like Ms office which has excel, word , outlook etc .Excel sheet has so many operations like insert formulae , pie charts , bar graphs  . computer provides HTML , it stands for Hyper text mark up language, it is also known as web designing this helps in designing web pages with various fonts , picture , styles . 

          In this busy life ,computers provides online shopping like Jabong , E-bay and Amazon which helps people who  are unable to go out for shopping as they dont have time.computers helps in booking tickets online like BookMy show, Ticket dada etc and it helps in booking bus tickets and train tickets.  

   computers play an important role in every ones life , it is one of the best invention which helps in gaining knowledge .

File Name:IndiaEconomicOutlook
Start editing from here.

 

           In 2008 India is gaining strong domestic factors nd it is growing very fast form the crisis , it is expected that India to be more than US$ 5 trillion according to the current market price. As of  2010 , india economy size will be comparable to the Japanese economy in terms of GDP in US dollars . In certain time period , some of the developed economies and emergence of certain domestic issues are responsible for restraining India`s growth .It is expected that India`s economic growth during the current decade to be good in service sector.

It is expected that investment activity to go ahead in the future that will help the Indian economy to have higher growth rate  and it is seen that shares of investment to Gross Domestic product to increase from 36.6% during FY10 to 40.7% during FY20. Investment helps in setting up an favourable policy environment that act as catalyst for the growth of Indian economy during the current years.

     For the econimc growth, Infrastructure will be both a cause and consequence during the current decades. There is a sharp groth in domestic savings that will help in supporting the domestic investments where the saving rate is increased from 33.8% during FY10 to 39,5% during FY20.

    As  Compared to 60.0% during FY11 , the share of discretionary spending is expected to rise 70% of private final consumption expenditure under consumption in the current years which helps in the growth of Indian economy.

   They various economic growth drivers are 

          To achieve " inclusive growth " , investments in social and physical infrastructure is the key growth driver in the current decades. It is expected to amount for 3.8% of GDP by FY20 of an infrastructure investment in the elecricity sector.

          It is expected that investment in physical infrastructure leads to various factors like employment generation, increased production efficiency , reductioin in cost of doing business and standard of living is expected to drive the infrastructure investment from around 6.0%% (BE) of GDP in FY12 to 11.5% of GDP by FY20.

 Government focuses more on Healthcare facilities and it is expected to increase the total Government expenditure on Healthcare from 1.3%(BE) of GDP in FY12 to 2.2% of GDP in FY20.  And it is also expected that investment in agriculture sector to increase from 2.6% (BE) of GDP in FY12 to 3.2% of GDP by FY20.

             It is observed that invesment in various sectors helps in the growth of the Indian economy.

 

 







#################--Don`t Delete below content#################

India Economic Outlook

India remained remarkably resilient from the global economic turmoil in 2008 owing to its strong domestic fundamentals and had been one of the fastest economies to recover from the crisis. Currently, the growth momentum of the Indian economy has again been impacted. This time around besides the prevailing crisis in some of the developed economies, emergence of certain domestic issues had played a major role in restraining India’s growth momentum. However, we believe that India’s long term growth prospects will remain buoyant driven by its underlying strong macroeconomic fundamentals. We believe that emphasis on boosting investment activity and setting up of a favorable policy environment will act as a catalyst to unravel the growth potential of the Indian economy during the current decade.

The highlights of the analysis have been provided below –

 

India’s macro-economic outlook 2020:

 

India is expected to be more than US$ 5 trillion (current market price) economy by FY20.

The size of the Indian economy will be comparable to the Japanese economy (in terms of GDP in US$) as of 2010

We expect the current phase of subdued growth to continue till FY15 before the economy moves into a high growth phase

India’s economic growth during the current decade is expected to be driven by the buoyancy in the services sector

Investment activity is expected to accelerate going ahead, which will help the Indian economy achieve a higher growth rate. Share of investment to GDP will increase to stand at 40.7% of GDP during FY20 from 36.6% during FY10

Infrastructure will be both a cause and a consequence of economic growth during the current decade

 

Strong growth in domestic savings will support domestic investment. The savings rate is expected to surge to 39.5% during FY20 from 33.8% during FY10

 

Under consumption, share of discretionary spending is expected to rise significantly to 70% of private final consumption expenditure (PFCE) as compared to 60.0% (P) in FY11

 

Economic growth drivers:

 

Substantial investments in social and physical infrastructure will be the key growth drivers that will enable the economy to achieve ‘inclusive growth’ over the current decade

Infrastructure investment in the electricity sector is expected to account for 3.8% of GDP by FY20

Investment in physical infrastructure is expected to lead to employment generation, increased production efficiency, reduction in cost of doing business and improved standard of living which is expected to drive infrastructure investment (as measured by Gross Fixed Capital Formation) to 11.5% of GDP by FY20 from around 6.0% (BE) of GDP in FY12

Increased government focus towards improving overall healthcare facilities is expected to enhance total government expenditure on healthcare to 2.2% of GDP in FY20, as against 1.3% (BE) of GDP in FY12

The share of the private sector in infrastructure financing is expected to increase from 39.4% in FY12 (P) to 48.0% in FY20

Investment in the agriculture sector is expected to grow to around 3.2% of GDP by FY20 as against 2.6% (BE) of GDP in FY12
